text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The core legal issue presented by the prompt is whether the long-term, rent-free occupation grants the individual legal protection against immediate eviction by the new owner. This protection hinges entirely on the legal concept of 'actual occupation' (which determines tenancy status, security of tenure, and overriding interests against a new purchaser). The candidate answer correctly identifies and structures its entire analysis around determining the user's status as a 'tenant' versus a 'licensee' based on exclusive possession, which is the direct application of the principle of actual occupation in this context.", "criterion_id": "d3fe8fdc-4186-4aac-aa48-c595472e7863"}
